subject: RE: [junit] Cannot find JNDI in Visual Age
msgSnippet: Are you running JUnit from within VAJ?  If so, are you using code like this: Context ctx = new InitialContext(); String s =
messageBody:
Are you running JUnit from within VAJ? If so, are you using code like this:

Context ctx = new InitialContext();
String s = ParsingService.class.getName().replace( '.', '/'
);
Object ref = ctx.lookup( s );

ParsingServiceHome home = ( ParsingServiceHome )
PortableRemoteObject.narrow( ref, ParsingServiceHome.class );
ParsingService bean = home.create();

It works fine for us here...

FYI,
Steve Warsa
Avnet, Inc.

-----Original Message-----
From: tsmets@... [mailto:tsmets@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 11, 2001 4:35 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Cannot find JNDI in Visual Age



I'm currently developing EJB in VAfJ.
I wonder if the classes called by the TestCase could access the JNDI
service. It seems the TestCase itself can access the Context but the Context
lookup (in the test class seem to fail).

Do I have to do something specific to access the JNDI server then ?

Tx,

Thomas,
